title: Will Labour MPs be able to resist the temptation to vote for Boris's Brexit deal?
text:
Over the last few weeks, Jeremy Corbyn has kicked off his election campaign. It looks a lot like the playbook that worked so well in 2017: big rallies, held in safe Labour seats but designed to make clippable Facebook videos for everywhere, their locations deliberately chosen to make headlines in the local news and local television broadcasts, which Team Corbyn believe give them a fairer hearing than the national press. There has been a steady diet of radical policies, again, all with a distinctly 2017 flavour: something for everybody, paid for by the wealthy few.

In the summer of 2017, the approach yielded good headlines, particularly on radio, and did very well on social media. But as autumn...
description: Over the last few weeks, Jeremy Corbyn has kicked off his election campaign.
